titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Clark S. Marlor Brooklyn ephemera collection 2001.006
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:34 +0000.

did.unittitle: Clark S. Marlor Brooklyn ephemera collection

physdesc.extent: in one manuscript box and one oversize box.

did.abstract: This collection consists of various ephemera relating to Brooklyn, donated to the Brooklyn Historical Society by Clark S. Marlor. Items include programs, a calendar, greeting and note cards, and pages from issues of Harper's Weekly from the 1860s containing images and information of significance to Brooklyn history. Also included are records of expenses for the funeral of Z.H. Zerbe.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Clark S. Marlor Brooklyn ephemera collection, 2001.006, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
